ui.w: Typography sets default styles for headings, paragraphs, semantic text, blockquote and lists elements.
All HTML headings, [color=#bd4147] h1 [/color] through [color=#bd4147] h6 [/color], are available.

w.w: <w type="h1">h1. LCUI heading</w> <w type="h2">h2. LCUI heading</w> <w type="h3">h3. LCUI heading</w> <w type="h4">h4. LCUI heading</w> <w type="h5">h5. LCUI heading</w> <w type="h6">h6. LCUI heading</w>

ui.w: [color=#bd4147] .h1 [/color] through [color=#bd4147] .h6 [/color] classes are also available, for when you want to match the font styling of a heading but cannot use the associated HTML element.
